Oldschool client might be a reason to get you banned for macroing.

description:
Jagex seems to have a tendency to permanently ban people out of the blue for no reason anyway. was the case for me.
Loyal adult fan and paying customer for years and took a break only to come back to find skills rolled back and many items missing. I then try to get back on a few years later than that and find they had band me on my birthday a year before that during a time I had not played in years.
No way to ask them why or make an appeal or complaint to them.
I am truly disappointed in them.
summary: Oh well, So I cant play

description:
Jagex will ban You for using this app. Reason: macroing.
Years of gameplay is lost for me...
Guys this game is awesome BUT this reppo is corrupted so search for second Runescape and install it.
i was excited to play. i created my account and character, then it kept crashing
love it, works great!

First: Other reviewers, please review on the UNIX clien, not the game. For god's sake... anyway. This RSU client used to wok, but now it'll load to 100% then crash to desktop. What happened? Hope the devs of this client fix it. FYI to others: this client is not officially supported since RS in general has yet to be supported on Linux.
I've been a runescaper for years, so when I made the choice to port over to Linux I was worried. But this app does what I need it to (for oldschool runescape). I haven't had any problems with it!

This didn't even work when I tried it a few months ago, however Jagex have now updated their client and download so that the official client works on Linux, it's probably worth moving to that now anyways.
well, at least i got to choose the install language before it crashed!
I've played the mobile game, so I was excited, but this thing doesn't even start.
summary: Great app, would recommend, if it worked that is

description: i installed it it didn't word i uninstalled and installed it still doesn't word i restart my computer it still doesn't work fix the game plz

So when I initially tried installing it with the Discover software center, I had the knowledge of it working from the GNOME Software center. When it wouldn't start after being installed with Discover, I was confused. I went and tried to install RSU manually and that did not work as well. Out of sheer desperation I installed the Snap Store (snap install snap-store) and found that when I installed that one that it worked (although it was listed as OS Runescape Launcher without a proper icon).

Then, to post a review of this version on Discover I had to reinstall the version that I had from discover since I had already uninstalled it before installing the Snap Store version. Upon reinstalling this version provided by Discover I found that this version suddenly worked. Now what I don't know is whether this Discover version worked because I reinstalled it or if it works only because I had installed the Snap Store one. I don't think these osrs clients are the same because the one from the snap store does not come with a launcher/updater interface whereas this one does.

The Discover version of Old School Runescape is the RSU-Launcher version which allows you to use which prm you want to play. I use oldschool.prm, which I was able to select next to the refresh news button.

The Snap Store version I had installed before reinstalling the Discover version. I launched it just before I had reinstalled the Discover version and found that it worked at least as far as the main menu screen. In order to be able to post a review of the version from Discover I had to reinstall the Discover version. When I did that, I found that it was suddenly working. I played a bit of that version. After testing that version I decided to continue playing the snap store version. Both versions seem to work. I don't know what the heck happened. 

Maybe the Snap Store version installed a dependency that the Discover version needed in order to run? Both of them work fine now!

Anyway, if you want my opinion on the game itself, it is great. Fantastic. It works pretty well on old computers, too. I have a computer from 2006 -- a ThinkPad T60 with a Core2Duo T7200 running Lubuntu 18.04 Linux -- that ran it nicely. For my testing in Kubuntu 20.04 I was using my desktop with a Ryzen 5 2600 + GTX 1070 combo. Also works fine.
summary: (PLEASE READ) I might have gotten it working

description:
You will have to download the .dmg file from the official server, get to a terminal (xterm) and run these commands AFTER INSTALLING THIS SNAP:

cd /tmp
wget 'https://www.runescape.com/downloads/OldSchool.dmg'
mkdir ~/.local/share/runescape
7z e OldSchool.dmg
cp jagexappletviewer.jar ~/.local/share/runescape

You can delete any files created in /tmp after you do this. These commands I pasted directly from my terminal after successfully getting it to run on 20.04 xubuntu 64. Have fun!
summary: It does work, please read this
